content.question: Which of the following correctly characterizes one of Earthâ€™s atmospheric layers?

choices.label: Layer <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is the stratosphere, where meteors are found.
Layer <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is the troposphere, where weather occurs.
Layer <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is the stratosphere, where the ozone layer is found.
Layer <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is the thermosphere, where auroras are found.

content.answer: Layer <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is the thermosphere, where auroras are found.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe characteristics of an environmental concept, process, or model represented visually.
